bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to L. M. Phillips, September 19, 1921

div1.p: Carter decides to keep his money in the Peruvian bank.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to L. M. Phillips, September 19, 1921
div1.opener:
2121 California St/ N. W.
Washington, D. C.
Sept. 19/21.
Mr. L. M. Phillips,
Assistant Manager,
Banco Mercantil Americano Del Peru,
Lima, Peru.
Deaar Sir:
div1.p:
In answer to your letter of August 22nd., relative to my
account with the Banco Mercantil Americano, I would ask you to
continue holding it for the 6 months beginning Sept. 8/21, at
the same rate of interest--5%--as hitherto, and--unless advised to
the contrary--to continue this for the next 6 months ending Sept/22
by which time I should think Peruvian exchange should be stabil-
ized and I hope at a higher level than at present.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Address
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
2121 California Street, N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
